sml

Class Translator

  • java.lang.Object
    • sml.Translator

  • public class Translator
extends java.lang.Object
    The translator of a SMalL program. Uses reflection to open up instances of classes.
    Author:
    John Spear and BBK

      • readAndTranslate

        public boolean readAndTranslate(Labels lab,
                                java.util.ArrayList<Instruction> prog)

      • getInstruction

        public Instruction getInstruction(java.lang.String label)
        Each line of text in the file should contain one instruction split by space. This function uses reflection to load an instance of the correct class (by reading the opcode in the file) and using the parameter. The classes I created only had one constructor but the classes already made (add and lin) had two constructors so I checked to see which the longest constructor was before using it to instantiate the object.
        Parameters:
        label - String The label which has already been stripped from the line of text
        Returns:
        newInstruction Instruction The instruction which has been instantiated from reading the line of the text file.

      • getParams

        public java.lang.Object[] getParams(java.lang.String label,
                                    java.lang.reflect.Constructor con)
        Places the label as the first item in the array then loops through the constructor's required items, choosing whether to use scan or scanInt based upon whether the param is an int or a string.
        Parameters:
        label - String The label which has already been stripped from the line of text. Is going to be the first item in the array.
        con - Constructor The constructor which is going to be used to create the instance.
        Returns:
        params Object[] An array of the correct constructors taken from the file.
